intro: Hemionitis ternifolia, commonly known as the basket fern, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a terrestrial fern characterized by its distinctive, fan-shaped fronds that form a dense, bushy appearance. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome with numerous roots that anchor it to the soil. Its leaves are typically divided into three parts, giving it the species name *ternifolia*, meaning "three-parted." Hemionitis ternifolia thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
